Title: Remove Operations
Description: Learn how to remove items from inventory.

Topics.Title: Basic Remove
Topics.Summary: Remove items using the normal Remove tab.
Topics.Content:
Basic Remove

The Remove tab provides a simple interface for removing inventory items from the system.

How to Remove Items

  1. Navigate to the Remove tab (Ctrl+2).
  2. Enter or scan the Part Number.
  3. Enter or scan the Location.
  4. Enter the Quantity to remove.
  5. Click Delete or press Delete key.

Undo

You can undo the last deletion by pressing Ctrl+Z. This restores the most recently removed item back to inventory.

Note: Only the most recent deletion can be undone. Once you perform another operation, the undo buffer is cleared.

Topics.Title: Advanced Remove
Topics.Summary: Search and remove multiple items at once.
Topics.Content:
Advanced Remove

For more complex removal operations, use Advanced Remove to search for and remove multiple items.

How to Use

  1. Click Advanced Remove button or press Ctrl+N to toggle between Normal and Advanced modes.
  2. Enter search criteria (Part Number, Location, Job Number, etc.).
  3. Click Search (Ctrl+S) to find matching items.
  4. Review the results in the grid.
  5. Select items to remove (use Shift or Ctrl for multiple selections).
  6. Press Delete to remove selected items.

Reset Search

Press Ctrl+R to clear all search fields and results.
